Sofyan Basir di Vonis Bebas, KPK : Kami Akan Berusaha Membuktikan
04 Nov 2019, 13:43 by Chairul Umam


Sofyan Basir di Vonis Bebas, KPK : Kami Akan Berusaha Membuktikan

KBRN, Jakarta : Pengadilan Tindak Pidana Korupsi (Tipikor) memvonis bebas eks Direktur Utama PT PLN Sofyan Basir,Senin (4/11/2019).
Wakil Ketua Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK) Laode Muhammad Syarif mengaku baru mengetahui putusan tersebut dari teman-temannya di pengadilan. Laode mengungkapkan akan mendiskusikannya secara internal dan akan berusaha bisa membuktikan semuanya.
"Terus terang kita baru tau juga dari teman-teman pengadilan memutuskan seperti itu, nanti Jaksa KPK akan melaporkan kepada kami, dan setelah itu kami akan diskusikan secara internal, tetapi kami akan berusaha semaksimal mungkin untuk bisa membuktikan itu," ungkap Laode di gedung KPK.
Laode mengatakan, pihaknya enggan bekomentar terkait sikap KPK ke depan karena belum menerima salinan putusan Sofyan basir
Dalam sidang tuntutannya, Sofyan dituntut lima tahun penjara dan denda Rp 200 juta subsider 3 bulan kurungan. Mantan Direktur Utama BRI itu dianggap turut membantu terjadinya tindak pidana korupsi berupa suap terkait proyek PLTU Riau-1.

Sofyan Basir in Free Verdict, KPK: We Will Try to Prove It
04 Nov 2019, 13:43 by Chairul Umam


Sofyan Basir in Free Verdict, KPK: We Will Try to Prove It

KBRN, Jakarta: The Corruption Court (Tipikor) has acquitted the former President Director of PT PLN Sofyan Basir, Monday (11/04/2019).
Deputy Chairperson of the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) Laode Muhammad Syarif said he only learned about the decision from his friends in court. Laode said he would discuss it internally and would try to prove everything.
"To be honest, we just learned from court friends that, the Prosecutors of the Corruption Eradication Commission will report to us, and after that we will discuss it internally, but we will try our best to prove it," Laode said in the KPK building. .
Laode said, he was reluctant to comment related to the attitude of the Commission in the future because it had not received a copy of Sofyan Basir's decision
In his trial, Sofyan was charged with five years in prison and a fine of Rp. 200 million in a 3-month confinement. The former President Director of BRI was considered to have helped the occurrence of corruption in the form of bribery related to the Riau-1 PLTU project.
